intro: Guatteria brevicuspis, commonly known as the short-spined guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves, which are usually elliptical and have a leathery texture. Its small, white flowers are clustered in inflorescences, and it produces berries that are edible for certain wildlife. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
